{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3026582,"name":"Logan Piercy","username":"lpiercy4342","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/c37758/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-21T01:00:20.192Z","cooked":"

Our team was experiencing some brown-out issues that probably stem from bad batteries. We bought them during the 2020 season and have been using them ever since. Upon experiencing our issues, we did some more research and learned that there is much more we should be doing to preserve our batteries. So please leave any recommendations of reliable, up-to-date batteries to buy as well as any preservation actions that your team may take.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2022-03-21T01:29:06.270Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":32,"reads":346,"readers_count":345,"score":274.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":406282,"topic_slug":"recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them","display_username":"Logan Piercy","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50464,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them/406282/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3026604,"name":"Carl Guo","username":"carlguo866","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/carlguo866/{size}/164426_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-21T01:19:36.968Z","cooked":"

MK batteries r pretty nice and they usually have a relatively reasonable price and reliable customer service. We bought a few this year and some dropped from 130% to, say, 110% within minutes but per customer services‚Äô instruction, it would stop having this issue once we depleted and used them for at least 20 cycles. You can check out this thread for sources to purchase batteries: Best Purchasing Source for FRC Legal Batteries

Think about the repercussions.","username":"DonRotolo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/donrotolo/{size}/177200_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-21T10:11:19.069Z","cooked":"

Keep them charged.
Nothing hurts a lead-acid battery than being in a discharged state.

There are many older threads on this topic, search.

Think about the repercussions.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4207,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"No Longer Registered"},"post_url":"/t/recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them/406282/3","custom_user_title":"No Longer Registered","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3073009,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2022-07-15T15:08:51.744Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôm working on a cheaper way to do an energy storage test‚Ä¶

A painfully won lesson: you need to do an energy storage test before each competition if you can afford the tool. We had TWO 2022 batteries that went from 18,000 to 1,600 mAhrs between our first comp and TRI! We don‚Äôt know -when- that happened

If you don‚Äôt have the tool, run a 3 minute practice match on each battery. That would have caught our bad ones. Good for drivers too!

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2022-07-15T15:08:51.744Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":217,"readers_count":216,"score":63.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":406282,"topic_slug":"recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them/406282/4","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3073014,"name":"Brian Wagg","username":"cad321","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-07-15T15:35:07.324Z","cooked":"

Question for teams working out of a school where you don‚Äôt have access over the summer, how are you ensuring your batteries aren‚Äôt left sitting for 2 months with no charger/use?

For 10 months out of the year, I‚Äôd imagine some kind of trickle charge setup would be good to ensure the batteries aren‚Äôt left depleted too long (input/suggestions for this kind of setup would be great too). Do you then send your battery setup home with a mentor/teacher to monitor over the summer?

To sum it up I guess, how do you put your batteries into ‚Äúlong term‚Äù storage during the summer/offseason?

*I‚Äôd say this question relates really well to OP‚Äôs post, but if mod‚Äôs feel it necessary, we can split this into it‚Äôs own thread too *

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2022-07-15T15:36:17.745Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":204,"readers_count":203,"score":70.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":406282,"topic_slug":"recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them","display_username":"Brian Wagg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19532,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Brian Wagg"},"post_url":"/t/recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them/406282/5","custom_user_title":"Brian Wagg","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3073027,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2022-07-15T16:55:18.559Z","cooked":"
cad321:

Question for teams working out of a school where you don‚Äôt have access over the summer, how are you ensuring your batteries aren‚Äôt left sitting for 2 months with no charger/use?

We just top them off before the school year ends. Which may not be the most perfectly correct strategy, but it heads off the worst outcomes.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2022-07-15T16:55:18.559Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":176,"readers_count":175,"score":40.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":406282,"topic_slug":"recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them/406282/6","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3073030,"name":"Saraansh Wadkar","username":"saraansh","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/saraansh/{size}/196465_2.png","created_at":"2022-07-15T17:22:15.134Z","cooked":"

Batteries do discharge slowly over time even more so if you aren‚Äôt putting them in a temperature controlled place during the summer so leaving them uncharged for 2 ish months might hurt the batteries in the long term.

If you want to keep them charged there are options to buy battery tenders (essentially trickle chargers but smarter because they know when to start/stop) but these can be expensive to use on an entire fleet of batteries.

Sending the batteries and chargers with a mentor and teacher is a really safe and cheap option, although more effort for said person, but regardless of whichever option you do I would invest in a battery analyzer tool and check the batteries after the summer in the case something unnoticeable happens.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2022-07-15T17:22:15.134Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":169,"readers_count":168,"score":38.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":406282,"topic_slug":"recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them","display_username":"Saraansh Wadkar","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":19532,"username":"cad321","name":"Brian Wagg","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50209,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"he/him"},"post_url":"/t/recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them/406282/7","custom_user_title":"he/him","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3073031,"name":"Brad","username":"Bmongar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png","created_at":"2022-07-15T17:28:19.586Z","cooked":"

Also charge at lower amps like 2 instead of 5 or 6. There are maintainers that will allow you to leave a battery plugged in for long periods of time and it will allow some discharge then it will fill. We have multiple Noco Genius 2 with Anderson AB50 plugs on them to keep our batteries

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2022-07-15T17:28:19.586Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":158,"readers_count":157,"score":41.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":406282,"topic_slug":"recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them","display_username":"Brad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38557,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector "},"post_url":"/t/recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them/406282/8","custom_user_title":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3073048,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2022-07-15T19:49:26.833Z","cooked":"
Bmongar:

Also charge at lower amps like 2 instead of 5 or 6.

In the age of older chargers that just dumped current blindly into the battery, I could see this aiding longevity. I‚Äôd like to see the receipts for this still being valid in an age where most every charger has smarts to it and they‚Äôre trying to top off the battery just right.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2022-07-15T19:49:26.833Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":137,"readers_count":136,"score":92.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":406282,"topic_slug":"recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them/406282/9","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3073056,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2022-07-15T20:54:06.040Z","cooked":"

Our team was experiencing some brown-out issues that probably stem from bad batteries.

Good advice here ‚Äì but brownout can have multiple (or other causes). If things were good with some batteries, you are probably good on other causes. But there are quite a few very common causes for this sort of thing, including the connections to the batteries and going from there.

Also, COVID was really tough on batteries for many teams that couldn‚Äôt look after them.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2022-07-15T21:09:25.655Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":77.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":406282,"topic_slug":"recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them/406282/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3073067,"name":"snoman","username":"snoman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/snoman/{size}/7189_2.png","created_at":"2022-07-15T22:07:12.355Z","cooked":"

Low amp charging is best we use this

andymark.com

Battery Charger 3 Bank 6 Amp Dual Pro RS3 with SB-50A Connectors

Battery Charger, 3 Bank, 6 AMPs

Really doing a load test is the best way to see if the battery is good or not.
I know this is a bit of an expense but our HUB got one last year and shared it with the teams. It is kinda amazing.
Got rid of 3 batteries that seemed good on the battery beak! And 1 more that is practice only

andymark.com

Computerized Battery Analyzer

The computerized Battery Analyzer is much more than a simple battery voltage tester or a battery load tester. It will test virtually any type or size of battery, any chemistry or number of cells, up to 55 volts. We are making this tester available...

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2022-07-15T22:10:00.038Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":124,"readers_count":123,"score":34.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":406282,"topic_slug":"recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them","display_username":"snoman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.andymark.com/products/computerized-battery-analyzer","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Computerized Battery Analyzer - AndyMark, Inc","clicks":9},{"url":"https://www.andymark.com/products/battery-charger-3-bank-6-amp-dual-pro-rs3-with-sb-50a-connectors","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Battery Charger 3 Bank 6 Amp Dual Pro RS3 with SB-50A Connectors - AndyMark, Inc","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21744,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them/406282/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3073106,"name":"sanddrag","username":"sanddrag","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/c68b51/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-07-16T00:40:58.453Z","cooked":"

If you drive your batteries down to the point at which your robot‚Äôs motion is stuttering and struggling to move, you are already damaging your batteries. Most teams probably discharge them further than they ought to when practicing.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2022-07-16T00:40:58.453Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":96.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":406282,"topic_slug":"recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them","display_username":"sanddrag","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1082,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them/406282/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3073113,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2022-07-16T01:16:17.784Z","cooked":"
snoman:

Low amp charging is best we use this

  1. I would still like the receipts on lower-current charging with a modern charger being better for the battery‚Äôs short-term or long-term capacity.
  2. ‚Ä¶you know 'ya went and linked to a charger rated for the highest FRC-legal charge rate with zero adjustment options to turn it down, right?
sanddrag:

Most teams probably discharge them further than they ought to when practicing.

And it‚Äôs easy to get sucked into that trap. We were at SCRAP last year trying to dial in out our (fully open-loop) shooter at the practice field, and the kids kept running it and running it and running it wondering why their shots were missing low. I touched the NEO briefly (quite toasty, quelle surprise) and finally had to stop them like a parent trying to keep their preschooler from going through the McDonalds playground one more time so we could get ready for the next match.

Billfred:

you know 'ya went and linked to a charger rated for the highest FRC-legal charge rate with zero adjustment options to turn it down, right?

Yeah, two amp charger would probably be better for the overall health of the battery. Granted I am not an electrical engineer in, Or do I play one on TV.
It‚Äôs a good overall charger solid and robust and one that you can bring to competition.

I was unaware that FIRST regulated the type of charger I could use. Never had an RI check that as they were going through their list.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2022-07-16T05:04:26.103Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":83,"readers_count":82,"score":26.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":406282,"topic_slug":"recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them","display_username":"Jeffrey Morris","primary_group_name":"Swyft-Robotics","flair_name":"Swyft-Robotics","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/1/11d561f5bb3f02abd1014df6f9a83d9ec434d6d1.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":64,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51948,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"SWYFT Robotics | 7125 AM"},"post_url":"/t/recommendations-for-reliable-budget-friendly-batteries-and-how-to-best-treat-them/406282/15","custom_user_title":"SWYFT Robotics | 7125 AM","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3073155,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2022-07-16T14:14:13.259Z","cooked":"

@sanddrag the bots start the stuttering at 10.5 Volts. The RoboRio has a ‚Äúbrownout‚Äù bit that turns all the motors off when it hits that threshold. I‚Äôm not sure how long they stay off.
The key bit there is that it‚Äôs 10.5 Volts under load. A 200 Amp motor load will pull it right down! I had to do some teaching with the drivers on this‚Ä¶ Don‚Äôt just hold the stick and let it stutter; just ease the stick forward and find a happy speed!

The brownout kicks in at 6.3 volts (Rio 1) or 6.75 volts (Rio 2). See the below link for more detail.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

roboRIO Brownout and Understanding Current Draw

In order to help maintain battery voltage to preserve itself and other control system components such as the radio during high current draw events, the roboRIO contains a staged brownout protection...

If only one motor is stuttering, that‚Äôs more commonly due to a breaker trip. They‚Äôre auto reset breakers so will come back on in a short time.
